intro: Parosela psoralioides, commonly known as the yellow parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
